subject: Ethics
title: DNA Database Privacy
description: A quick, practical guide to DNA Database Privacy.

hook.text: Police caught the Golden State Killer using his cousin's DNA from a genealogy website. Great detective work?

buildup.text: The cousin never consented to a police search. They just wanted to find their ancestry.

discovery.text: When you upload DNA, you expose not just yourself but every blood relativeâ€”without their knowledge or consent.

twist.text: The same tool that catches serial killers could identify dissidents, screen employees, or deny insurance.

climax.text: Your DNA is the most personal data you have. Once it's in a database, you can never take it back.

punchline.text: Your cousin uploaded their DNA. Now police have yours too.

quiz.question: Why is using genealogy DNA databases for police investigations ethically controversial?
options: DNA evidence is unreliable and frequently leads to wrongful convictions
Police must obtain a warrant before accessing any DNA database
Uploading your DNA exposes all blood relatives without their knowledge or consent
